title: Barclays Reshuffles Leadership for Post-Jes Staley Era; New CEO, C.S. Venkatakrishnan, names members of his top team
text:
Paul Compton will head the corporate and investment bank, which he previously led with Mr. Venkatakrishnan, Barclays said Tuesday. They both joined Barclays from JPMorgan Chase & Co., where Mr. Staley also previously worked. Alistair Currie will lead consumer banking and payments at Barclays.

Ashok Vaswani, previously head of consumer banking, was appointed chief digital strategy officer. His new role reflects the need for traditional banks to respond to competition from startup financial technology companies.

"As technology shapes customers' interactions with banks, Ashok will accelerate the strategy and execution of Barclays' consumer-facing digital products and services," the bank said.

Mr. Staley, 64, stepped down under pressure from regulators over how he characterized his relationship with Epstein. The probe found that Mr. Staley had provided an incomplete picture of his relationship with the financier, according to people familiar with the investigation.

Barclays said the investigation didn't find evidence that "Mr. Staley saw, or was aware of, any of Mr. Epstein's alleged crimes," and said Mr. Staley intended to contest the regulators' conclusions.

Barclays shares were down 1% Tuesday afternoon in London, having risen 29% this year.
